title: Drawing, "Coriolanus Agrees to Lift the Siege of Rome", late 19th century
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash over traces of graphite on cream laid paper
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Coriolanus shown in his camp extending his arm toward his mother, Veturia. She speaks to him while wife, Volumnia, and other women and children urge him by praying.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Coriolanus Agrees to Lift the Siege of Rome", late 19th century.
late 19th century. Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash over traces of graphite on cream laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-2426.
